column6: Promises Match Performance
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
column14: I tried several of these rear view camera systems and had to return all of them.  The promises didnt match the performance.  This system - with a Sony camera and new software managing the light changes - was recommended to me and I am finally satisfied.  The Sony camera makes a big difference and the software adjusts well for the headlight effect - no blinding flare out. See video.  The rearview parking lines need improvement but it's not a deal killer with the core features sharp and functional. I hope/trust they address this in a firmware/software update.  All in all it's a great way to add technology to car without a huge price tag.  The package comes with everything including a 32 GB memory card.

column6: The only dashcam/ backup cam you need!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
column14: This is an upgrade to an already amazing dashcam/backup camera! I didnt know it could get any better but the new size and shape was an improvement! The touchscreen is even more responsive and the camera has more viewing angles than before. Also, the new split screen view is very nice to have. There is a review that says the quality is bad and it turns out blue. This is not true, the person just didnt take off the blue protective film that covers the lens while it's in the package. You have to remove this film before use. Super easy to install and if you have any problems, pormido is really quick to help and are very nice!

column6: Easy to install, ultra clear video, and comes with glare screen & micro sd card - great buy!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
column14: My family owns a Nissan NV 3500 12 passenger van - it's a great vehicle for transporting multiple children/family members all around town.  My one gripe about the van, though, is that the rearview mirror is basically worthless.  It looks to the back of the van, and while I can spy on children hitting each other or rolling thier eyes at me or their siblings, it doesn't work well to allow me to see behind the van on account of the multiple headrests and tall passengers.

column6: Video quality is suck . . . too smoky blue, poor quality.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
column14: I am very anxious and so excited to receive this dash cam but very disappointed after seeing video on this dash cam so blue and smoky.  I tried to adjust all I can on the setting, but nothing get any better.  On their ad, they look so real and so natural but are so blue and smoky on this dash cam.  As you can see it on my video and photo and compare it for yourself, they are not even closed.  I am very disappointed and will return it.  Packaging too is too slopy, inside the package there is no paper or foam to protect the unit box from rolling during shipping.  Very very poor!  Don't buy. . . . not recommended.

column6: Awesome Pormido PR996
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
column14: This is the first Dash Cam I've ever used.  Before Purchasing, I did extensive research on dash cameras.  I researched the cheapest and most expensive ones on the market and all in between.  Then I just so happen to find this gem that replaces your rearview mirror.  My goal was to find a dual dash cam that can record front and back.  Pormido does this with ease.  Now I have confidence and can rest a little easy because if anything happens on the road, front or back accidents, I have video evidence.

column6: Front and Back view on ONE screen at same time
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
column14: High resolution picture on big screen with double view at same time. Record both front and back videos in high quality. Not only shows up the timer on screen but also on the recorded videos and pictures. Best evidence for your record. (One of the my old videos help me win the traffic case: not yield to the pedestrian...)

column6: Only dual Blu-ray player that's portable, reliable, and battery powered!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
column14: This is by far, in terms of quality and functionality, the best portable DVD player I've ever seen or used. Add to that, it's a Blu-ray player! Picture quality is awesome, the player portion is constructed well. I've had no issues with any Blu-ray, DVD, or burnt discs playing (I have all my movies backed up to DVD-R and Blu-ray-R media so my kids don't wreck the good copy.) The battery life has been awesome so far, you will have no problem with watching a Blu-ray with both screens going without the battery dying. In the vehicle it's nice, as I just use the cigarette lighter jack in the center console which only has power when the key is on. Now to clear up any possible confusion, I'll make a few points:

column6: Good picture, very bad mounting design, not worth the money!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
column14: The player is nice and works well, for however long it's usable... Unfortunately I got only one use of it, because I can't mount it on the headrest anymore. The eyelets for the mounting straps are so flimsy as to be ridiculous. For a price tag on excess of 300 USD I expect a lot better product testing and quality! Very dissatisfied with the experience.

column6: Only dual portable blu ray player on market
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
column14: I ordered this portable blu ray player for 2 reasons: first, it was the only dual screen blu ray player i could find, and two, we are going on a long road trip soon.  I received the order two days after I placed it, and tried them out as soon as I could.  They are really easy to set up and they were up and running within a few minutes.  The load time is pretty fast for the blu ray discs to start playing, and with our kids mostly wanting new movie titles, most of the time, they are only available in blu ray.  Another pro is that the connection between screens has a firm connector, rather than just a plug in cord that will keep it tight and not fall out.  I have had my kids watch one movie on them and there were no problems.  I will update in the future if there becomes a problem.

column6: A good portable Blu Ray DVD/ SACD Disc player.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
column14: To be honest I mainly bought this to play my SACD Disks and not to watch DVDs, I have seen some on this, that is regular DVDs and the picture was good but seemed to be a little bit on the dark side but other than that it was good.  Here is a caveat for those who buy this to listen to SACD Disks like me, while this does play them, it will not work if the SACD Disk was burned from an ISO file, not sure why but it would not work on any of my  ISO ones but worked fine on ones that I burned from a music file (FLAC).  Even though the speakers are small they do have a good sound and you can always hook the 2 units together and have 4 speakers to work with.

column6: Didn‚Äôt work. Would not spin up disk.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
column14: Did not work. It would power on but would not recognize that there was a disk loaded. There is a plastic protrusion that is supposed to activate a micro switch but the micro switch is mounted off to the side of the plastic piece. Looks like the micro switch was soldered in backwards.

column6: Happy to have purchased
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
column14: So far the DVD players work wonderfully. I have them both set up for a long road trip and we have used them for probably 15 hours. They are easy to use and the picture quality is perfect.

column6: Good Quality
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2019
column14: Great picture quality and sound. Easy to use. Also comes with a 12v car charger which is nice when traveling.

column6: Not very portable, difficult to install
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
column14: The straps to connect the DVD player to the seats In The car are not user friendly and resulted in the plastic hooks breaking on both dvd screens.  The buckles are very difficult to tighten correctly to the units making difficult to quickly put in the car for a road trip.  The players themselves are okay.  We have had them for a little over a year and only used them 4 times... for long trips. We have had a few issues with dvd‚Äôs playing and skipping and freezing but mostly work okay... But every time I put them in the car is very frustrating and now that both units stay connections have broke, I would not recommend buying this set.  They should have come with Velcro straps and better connection system.

column6: Clear, compact, convenient and cool
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: This camera is great for me. It's a small/compact dash camera with the ability to record both front and inside of cabin. I had a previous dual dash camera that I had to run the rear camera wire throughout the cars trim and it was a pain. I needed a new camera but I didn't want the hassle of running wires throughout a van. This fit the bill as far as features. High def 1080@30fps quality recording for both front and rear cameras, the front and rear cameras are built into one solid device, GPS and WI-FI, The Wi-Fi feature is so awesome to be able to watch recordings through the app instead of taking the camera out or the MicroSD card out to view the recordings. Infrared LED lights for night time recording of inside the vehicle, photograph mode, G-sensor, Motion detection, Parking mode, Fatigue Driving Alert (which sends a time alert that you can set from 1,2,4 hours to take a break), easy to install and easy to navigate through menus and settings.

column6: Nice affordable dash cam
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
column14: I was looking for a dash cam, but didn't know where to start. After browsing for a while, I stumbled upon this one. I looked at all the features and thought the price was decent so I decided to get it a try. I am glad that I did get it. It was easy to set up and to get started I didn't have to open the instructions manual. I inserted an extra micro SD card that I had lying around, hooked up the USB cable, and it worked right away. It was pretty intuitive. After finally reading the instructions I saw that there is an app for it. I downloaded it and found it easy to use. The pictures and videos in this review were downloaded from the app to my phone. It was easy to do.  The video quality is pretty clear. It records both inside and outside at the same time. The sound quality is also pretty good, however I removed it from the video for privacy reasons. I saw some cams that are way more expensive but I have also saw that are cheaper. I don't know how good those cheap ones really are though. The only negative comment I have is that it doesn't come with the memory card. Maybe they can bump up the price $20 and include one in a future release. So far I definitely recommend this dash cam.

column6: A Great quality dash cam, at a great price.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: I've been sitting on the fence, for some time now, about getting a Dashcam, but finally decided, after much research, that I should purchase one. As a result, I bought this specific dashcam.

column6: ok deal with a few bugs
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
column14: 1. it is a ok deal for $80dollars  that provides most of the functions you need as a dashcam, the picture quality for the front is ok, but the rear camera isn't so, has a hard time to recognize plate numbers, so god forbidden, if anything happens at the back, close enough, i am still not certain, the rear camera will be able to pick up the plate number and  the pic is a bit darker than the front cam.

column6: Disconnects rear camera
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
column14: The rear camera at night doesn‚Äôt perform as well since it has horrible glare from car headlights. Also the rear camera disconnects and connects randomly duration of 10-20 minutes long whenever I wash my car or driving in the rain. I‚Äôm guessing the camera isn‚Äôt as water proof as they say‚Ä¶ the wires for the rear camera is very short especially if you try to tuck the wires neatly in your car interior trim. If you have a truck or a long car, I‚Äôd suggest you look elsewhere.

column6: Ok for what you pay for
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
column14: I got my very first one two days before I got my second one. First when I received my first dash cam it looked like it has been used before, and it did not have everything that it said it was going to have. The installation was simple, I did not had any issues with it at all while I was installing it, I have not connected the back lights to the camera so I do not know how that would work. The GPS on my first dash cam was missing.

column6: Great Dash-Cam/Rear view camera
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021
column14: This Review is about the dash cam with rearview mirror Model number G810 with GPS by by JOMSE.

column6: Watching Out For The Others
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
column10: If I like it... I review it!
column14: I like this camera, however I don‚Äôt understand it well enough to use it for every day use. I commute 5 miles every day to the base and traffic is terrible. You see some crazy stuff going on. Motorcycles driving up the center lane, people swerving & cutting someone else off at the last minute. I mainly bought this for the long trips away from the city after watching the videos of ‚ÄòIdiots in Cars‚Äô. People are crazier behind the wheel than anything else I have EVER seen. Safety is a priority in the courtroom. This helps.

column6: Nice little dash cam

column6: Suprisgly good for cheap...

Comes with a 32gb card and a USB stick. Also has a cable to plug into a cig lighter (which has a female USB also) and a cable to plug into your computer.

column6: Great dash cam day or night
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
column14: Great video quality day or night. I'll review the dash cam video on my computer and catch things I didn't see when I was driving at night. I purchased this dash cam for video evidence if anything would happen.

column6: Small size, that's good as it doesn't obscure your view.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
column14: Arrived on-time with all listed parts.

column6: Easy to Install, it turned on and started recording.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
column14: Easy to install. Turned on as soon a plugged it in. The suction it‚Äôs strong, just have to turn it clockwise to the right to tighten. Just need to adjust the date and time. Picture quality it‚Äôs good and colorful.

column6: Battery is garbage. Resets all settings to default
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
column14: The dash cam itself provides a good quality picture and feature set for the low price. The problem is that the built-in lithium ion battery is super duper weak. After connecting it for the first time and configuring my settings, it kept on going back to the default time and settings. This was occurring even after letting it charge in my car for around 15 mins. After driving around the around an hour, it finally charged up a little bit but it would they're the "low battery" alert right before powering down. If this brand new dash cam can't even charge up to 50% when it's brand new, then time will not be kind to this device. Unless you enjoy going through and reconfiguring this dashcam each time you hop in your car, I would look elsewhere. I tried emailing their support for some help or to get a replacement, but they were super slow to respond and didn't provide any help.
